description.narrative: Georgia - Regional Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project - Energy Rehabilitation Activity: The objective of the Energy Rehabilitation Activity is increased reliability of energy supply and reduced losses. The Activity will rehabilitate the Pipeline and provide advisory service to the Government to support the Ministry of Energy to further develop and implement its energy sector strategy. MCC Funding will be used to: (1) Rehabilitate the Pipeline and (2) Engage one or more firms (the "Energy Advisors") to support the Ministry of Energy to further develop and implement its energy sector strategy

condition.narrative: An Outside Project Manager remains engaged, pursuant to an agreement that the Board and MCC have duly approved and that is in full force and effect
Due to MCG Energy Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project Director Employment Termination, Energy Project Coordinator will be an Active Project Director.
Energy Advisor(s) are selected and engaged in accordance with a process acceptable to MCC, and a copy of the duly executed agreement has been delivered to MCC;
Energy Advisor(s) remains engaged, pursuant to an agreement that the Board and MCC have duly approved and that is in full force and effect
Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.
MCC is satisfied that GOGC is maintaining the Pipeline in accordance with Agreed Standards, as set forth in Schedule 1 to Annex I of the Compact

MCC is satisfied that GOGC maintains a collection rate (defined as the percentage of sales collected for all services provided in the form of cash payments (which cash receipts may include proceeds from the sale of gas taken as payment in kind for transmission services)) of at least 95% for each of the two immediately preceding consecutive calendar quarters

MCC is satisfied that the Government has developed and is maintaining a continuing Pipeline rehabilitation program, if applicable utilizing operating cash flow and carbon credit financing, as applicable
MCG provides GOGC's audited financial statements for each fiscal year within 6 months of the close of each fiscal year

MCG provides a list of all permits necessary to perform the project activity, including any required environmental permits and related public disclosure and consultation and certifies that such permits are on file and have been validly issued, are in full force and effect, and are non-appealable
MCG provides evidence of continued compliance, satisfactory to MCC, with Environmental Management Plan
MCG provides evidence that an environmental audit of GOGC, in form and substance acceptable to MCC, has been completed, and any required action plans are being implemented.
MCG provides evidence that appropriate personnel of GOGC have received official environmental, health and safety training

MCG provides evidence that each required completed resettlement plan is being implemented for any pipeline segment or area reflected in the construction works package in accordance with World Bank operational policy on involuntary resettlement and in a manner acceptable to MCC

MCG provides evidence that the Environmental Management Plan has been completed. MCG submitted a report to MCC demonstrating that all baseline environmental data described in the Environmental Management Plan has been collected. MCG provides evidence that the environmental analyses have been completed.
MCG selects and finalizes agreement(s) for construction works, as necessary, in accordance with a process acceptable to MCC and the agreement(s) remain in full force and affect

Neither the Government nor GOGC shall sell or transfer, or permit to be sold or transferred, the Pipeline and/or (i) in the case of the Government, a controlling interest in the GOGC Group (GOGC and its subsidiaries and affiliates) or the GGIC Group (GGIC and its subsidiaries and affiliates), or (ii) in the case of GOGC, the GGIC Group (GGIC and its subsidiaries and affiliates), unless GGIC is merged with and into GOGC, and shall not place or permit to be placed any Lien on the Pipeline, in each case until the expiration of the Compact Term, except as may be otherwise agreed by MCC in writing

usg:usg-activity.usg:purpose-statement: Georgia - Regional Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project - Energy Rehabilitation Activity: The objective of the Energy Rehabilitation Activity is increased reliability of energy supply and reduced losses. The Activity will rehabilitate the Pipeline and provide advisory service to the Government to support the Ministry of Energy to further develop and implement its energy sector strategy. MCC Funding will be used to: (1) Rehabilitate the Pipeline and (2) Engage one or more firms (the "Energy Advisors") to support the Ministry of Energy to further develop and implement its energy sector strategy
